## Lessons Learned
- ALWAYS work in sandbox first, never push to production without user approval
- Always take screenshots with Puppeteer and send to topic before asking for approval
- Always check variable scope when using variables in array definitions
- Behind nginx, always set app.set('trust proxy', 1) for express-rate-limit
- Always use new Date() when saving dates to MongoDB, not toString(). Mongoose won't auto-convert strings to Date type.

## Rules
When encountering situations related to "always":
- ALWAYS work in sandbox first, never push to production without user approval
- Always take screenshots with Puppeteer and send to topic before asking for approval
- Always check variable scope when using variables in array definitions
- Behind nginx, always set app.set('trust proxy', 1) for express-rate-limit
- Always use new Date() when saving dates to MongoDB, not toString(). Mongoose won't auto-convert strings to Date type.
